title: Victor Wanyama the 'worst dressed' player at Spurs, says teammate - Nairobi News
text:
Victor Wanyama the ‘worst dressed’ player at Spurs, says teammate Posted on Feb 16, 2017 9969 Views Harambee Stars captain, Victor Wanyama, poses for photos on June 24, 2016 after joining Tottenham Hotspur. PHOTO | COURTESY By NAIROBI NEWS REPORTER 
Harambee Stars captain, Victor Wanyama has been blasted by a Tottenham Hotspur teammate for his poor dress code. 
In what perhaps stands out as a tongue in cheek statement, Wanyama was singled out alongside Eric Dier by England defender Danny Rose, as having the “worst” fashion sense at the club. 
Rose told Soccer AM when asked about worst fashion offenders at the London club: “He (Dier) comes in the biggest gear you could ever imagine, he’s probably top of the list,” he said, adding “Victor Wanyama is a close second, he came in a fur hoodie the other day. It looked like he’d stolen something from Pat Butcher out of Eastenders.” 
IMPRESSIVE DISPLAYS 
What can’t be disputed about Wanyama, who joined Tottenham from Southampton mid last year, is his impressive displays at the club. 
The midfielder has featured in all Spurs league matches this season and is yet to lose a match at the White Hart Lane. 
What’s more, he was earlier this week named the English Premier League African Player of the Month of January, ahead of Chelsea’s Victor Moses and Manchester City midfielder Yaya Toure. Latest Stories
